intro: Bunias cakile, commonly known as sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of pinnately lobed leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found along shorelines. Bunias cakile is also known for its edible leaves, which have a slightly peppery flavor similar to mustard greens.
